short_summary: Research service to characterize grouts for Nuclear Power Demonstration and Whiteshell Reactor 1 In-Situ Disposal projects
description: The Innovation and Research Division (IRD) of the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC) requires research services from a contractor to provide a detailed report describing and presenting in details the results of the experimental program aiming to characterize some properties of the two grouts expected to be used by the Canadian Nuclear Laboratories (CNL) for the Nuclear Power Demonstration (NPD) and Whiteshell Reactor 1 (WR-1) In-Situ Disposal (ISD) projects to support CNSC staff in their assessment of the validity of the assumptions made in the safety analysis reports and, more generally, of the proposed grouts to fulfill their function in the ISD projects

##### Tender Description
The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission is seeking research services from a contractor to provide a comprehensive report detailing the results of an experimental program characterizing the properties of two grouts anticipated for use in the Nuclear Power Demonstration (NPD) and Whiteshell Reactor 1 (WR-1) In-Situ Disposal (ISD) projects. The purpose of this research is to support the Commission’s staff in evaluating the validity of assumptions made in safety analysis reports and assessing the capacity of the proposed grouts to fulfill their functions in the ISD projects.

##### Method of Procurement
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive – Open Bidding
* **Trade Agreements**: This bid is open to qualified contractors under various free trade agreements, including the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership.

##### Attachment
* Relevant tender documents, including the solicitation document, are available on the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website.
